docs.lead_paragraph: At her father's sentencing last year, Stacey Hoehmann was a figure of tortured outrage, providing her own pronouncement of doom for what she said was his sexual abuse of her as a teen-ager. ''Maybe nobody else saw what he did, but God did and He's not going to forget,'' she told the court and her father. ''So if you think it's over today, it's not, because your day is still coming. You're burning in hell for what you did.''

headline.main: Recanting a Sex Abuse Charge; Family Needs to Heal, but Which Statement Is the Lie?

docs.abstract: Judge Vincent J Alfieri Jr of Clarkstown, NY, Justice Court lifts order barring contact between Stacey Hoehmann and her father Joseph, who was convicted of abusing her when she was teen-ager; Ms Hoehmann, now 20, sent Alfieri letter in March contending that her accusation had been all lies; she said her father, who has been free on bail pending appeal of his conviction, was not guilty of charges for which he received a year in jail; Ms Hoehmann's new account has forced Dist Atty Louis Valvo, who believes her recantation is lie, to proceeed with case without cooperating victim, and it has forced Alfieri to decide whether he should throw out conviction he himself handed down; photo (M)
